item.title: Tokyo | Japanese newspaper correspondent killed in Gaza
item.description: A Palestinian correspondent from the Japanese newspaper The Asahi Shimbun was killed in the Gaza Strip, apparently by an Israeli attack. According to the newspaper, Mohammed Mansour, 29, died in the city of Khan Youis, in southern Gaza, on Monday. It is believed to have been killed by an attack by an Israelite missile. The newspaper initially told NHK that Mansour died with his wife and son still a baby, but then corrected the explanation, citing information that his wife and son were being treated in a hospital. Mansour, a native of Gaza, began working for The Asahi Shimbun in 2023. The young journalist worked at Rafah and Khan Youis, sending reports and photos about the evolution of the situation in Gaza. The newspaper issued a statement expressing the inevitable feeling of deep sadness and anger at his death. The publication emphasized that attacks on civilians, including journalists, can never be tolerated under any circumstances. Meanwhile, the Qatar-based Al Jazeera satellite TV station, said on Monday that one of its reporters was killed in another Israeli air strike in northern Gaza. Gaza authorities say the number of journalists killed in the territory has reached 208 since the conflict.

item.title: HISTORICAL BUILDINGS | Support applications open on Monday

The measure aims to increase the “motivation of the owners” to make regular reparations for their own initiative “and reinforce the safeguarding of classified and private buildings and cultural interest”. The purpose of the FDC is to finance “regular structural inspections or tests, external repair of classified and private buildings and cultural interest” Support is attributed through a subsidy, "being the amount financed by 50 to 80 percent of the expected expenses, up to 2 million patacas, with the maximum period of financial support of 12 months." item.title: Attack | Aggressor in psychological evaluation at the hospital
item.description: The man who attacked two people with a knife in a store in Travessa dos Anjos is indicted of the commission of attempted murder and severe offense to physical integrity. The information was revealed yesterday by the Judiciary Police, at a press conference, and cited by the newspaper or Mun. The 41-year-old suspect is a resident of Macao and is currently at the Conde São Januário Hospital Center, where he will be evaluated, as he is suspected of suffering from mental problems. According to the authorities, the man, unemployed and without a fixed residence, was inside and entered Macao at 1:30 pm on Tuesday, through Qingmao border. It was seen the wandering for several areas of the city, until it arrived at Rua do Campo, where at first it attacked a passerby with a Chapada, for no reason. Once the first attack, the man moved to a supermarket and bought a knife to peel fruit, with a blade about nine centimeters. Unimportant With the knife, the man entered the telecommunications store at Travessa dos Anjos, where four employees, three men and one woman were. Inside the store, without making him an anticipation, the man soon attacked one of the employees, who was struck in one of his arms. Another of the employees tried to prevent the attack, and was hit with a cut on the back of the neck that lasted for 18 centimeters to the back. Given the uncontrolled attack, the men eventually hid in a collection, which did not prevent the attacker from trying to persecute them. It was at this time that it dropped the knife. Without the white weapon, he turned to the maid who tried to drag out the store. The woman asked people who passed on the street, unsuccessfully, while stores employees contacted the authorities. When public security police officers arrived at the scene, they managed to control the man and, minutes later, to deliver him to the Judiciary Police. Employees told authorities that the attack began for no reason and that there was no discussion. The employee with neck and back injuries, who even lost consciousness, was sewn with 100 points. However, the vital organs have not been hit, so a quiet recovery is expected, with no danger of life.

item.title: Jockey Club | Cats adopted with health problems
item.description:
Among the 22 adopted cats living in the Macao Jockey Club, a outbreak of feline panleukopenia was detected, which led to the deaths of at least two animals. After the information was made public, the company of Macau Jockey Club announced the distribution of a support of 5,000 patacas to adopters
Among the 22 cats available for adoption by Macau Jockey Club and the animal animal protective society, at least eight were infected with feline panleucopenia and two died. The information was released by anima. According to the association, eight felines were diagnosed with parvovirus infections, which is regarded as highly contagious and dangerous. Among these eight, two died and six are, or were in serious condition, needing to receive expensive medical treatments. Detection of a surge of the disease in the cats that were in the Jockey Club is not a surprise, since on the day of adoptions there were three cats, of the 25 initially available, which were diagnosed with the disease. For this reason, only 22 cats were adopted during the campaign. Anima also reported that among these 22 cats only two had no health problems. However, there were other cases where felines had severe bronchitis, tooth fall, despite being only one year, and other respiratory system infections. “We deeply regret the heavy financial burden caused to adopters or the pain and suffering of adopted cats and kittens who died due to the virus,” was indicated. "We promise to continue to communicate actively with the Jockey Club of Macao to get compensation for the medical expenses incurred by adopters," he was added. In addition to the adoption cats promoted by Macau Jockey Club and anima, Mary Jean Reimer, actress, lawyer and activist for the animal rights of Hong Kong, also revealed that one of the Jockey Club cats who adopted positive tested for feline panleukopenia. Positive response When it issued the first statement, anima still did not confirm that the treatments of sick cats would be paid by Macau Jockey Club. Initially, it was feared that they would have to be the adopters to pay the costs. However, yesterday, almost 24 hours after the first publication reporting the problems, the company's administration agreed to distribute 5,000 patacas support for each cat adopted. Macau Jockey Club was involved in a new controversy with cats, when in the middle of this month, tried to send about 100 felines to the interior to an unknown destination that was never revealed. The sending of cats was approved by the Institute for municipal affairs, which in a statement even promised to ensure animal health conditions for transport to Zhuhai. However, several local animal protection associations have mobilized to prevent this outcome. In addition to the adoption promotion campaign, associations also received several of the cats. The animals were raised as bravery at Macau Jockey Club, where they had as their function hunting rats, as the use of space by horses prevented the use of chemicals. However, as they had not been sterilized, the cats reproduced until they were about 100. Now it is also known that they had developed several diseases.

item.title: Payments | Institutions teach the elderly how to use mobile phones
item.description:
An inquiry has revealed that more than three quarters of respondents over 60 do not know how to make electronic payments. In this sense, the government is encouraging social institutions to organize courses and lectures to teach the elderly how to use mobile applications. In addition, the CTT released discounts for the elderly in the purchase of mobile phones
Last year, the General Association of Respectful Elderly of Macao carried out an inquiry into the use of mobile phones by people over 60. Although more than 90 percent answered that he used mobile phone, 76.8 percent admitted not knowing how to make electronic payments and 18.6 percent of respondents stated that mobile data packages and mobile phones are expensive, minimizing their use. The statistics were presented by Deputy Leong Hong Sai, in a written interplies, in which he concludes that “the consciousness of the elderly about the use of intelligent technologies” is weak. In response, the president of the Institute of Social Action (IAS), Hon Wai, listed a series of measures designed to appeal the elders with technological knowledge. In order to “foster computer generalization”, IAS has encouraged social institutions “teaching the elderly how to use computer equipment, including smartphones, through recreational courses, workshops, courses or lectures”. Hon Wai highlighted the usefulness of using applications such as “Single Account”, “Bus Location” and “Macao Health Data Platform”. In addition, the president of IAS said that, to “demonstrate the affection for the elderly, CTT have been encouraging mobile telecommunications service operators to launch specially designed benefits for this age group”. Plans offer "unlimited data at restricted speed and allow the purchase of mobile phones at promotional prices." Warn The president of IAS also recalled that the older population can also enroll in courses of the Program for Development and Continuous Improvement for mobile phone applications and safe use of the internet. Hon Wai also stressed the effort to prevent the older population from being a victim of burlas. In addition to raising awareness in social institutions that offer services to the elderly, police authorities last year, 126 “Anti-Burial Lectures”, in which more than 8,300 people participated. Alongside this, last year, “the Judiciary Police went to Chinese restaurants, recreational, markets and vendin areas” to sensitize the elderly to be aware of burla schemes.

item.title: Mountain Island | Complaints of obstacles to integration
item.description:
Long lines to cross the border, insufficient health services, non -recognized addresses and letters that never reach the destination. These are some of the problems of Macao residents in Hengqin, that Deputy Nick Lei expects the government to be able to resolve
Deputy Nick Lei states that there are many obstacles to ensure the integration of Macao residents in Hengqin, and asks authorities to take new measures to improve the situation. Heard by the Citizen Journal, the deputy linked to the Fujian community indicated as one of the main obstacles the lack of conditions to cross the border, which makes those who live in Hengqin, but work or study in Macau has to often face long lines, especially during holidays or in the edge hours. As a solution to this issue, the deputy proposes that Macao authorities coordinate with the hengqin customs to install automatic border calculations or inspection channels only for Macao residents, in order to increase the speed of border passage. Regarding the identified problems, Nick Law also points out that the Health Center of the new Macao neighborhood of Hengqin, which began operating in November last year, has no regular blood harvesting service. Another of the identified flaws is the fact that some drugs available in Macao are not in Hengqin. Health services in the neighborhood for residents of Macau are thus considered insufficient. Law even reveals that there were residents who had to come to Macau to receive the necessary health treatments as they were not available in Hengqin. Bureaucratic problems In the list of complaints that appears in the statements made to the Citizen Journal, Nick Lei states that several residents find difficulties when they have to declare the address on Mountain Island with public services or financial institutions of Macao. According to the deputy, it is often that Hungqin addresses are not accepted in local institutions as a resident recognized in Macao. Another frequent situation happens when the home on mountain island is recognized, but correspondence never reaches the destination. Law thus asks the authorities to ask the post office on the other side of the border to find a way to overcome this obstacle. On the other hand, law regretted that the measure of the interior authorities so that the macao enrolled cars authorized to circulate in Hengqin could circulate throughout the Canton province has not yet come out of paper, although announced. Nick Law understands that integration is a process that takes its time, but argues that these aspects should be improved quickly to attract more residents from Macau to Hengqin.

item.title: Industrial Parks | Company with profits of 10 million patacas
item.description:
Despite the company's operational profits for the development of Macau's industrial parks worsened with 2023, capital interest gains allowed to improve results by about 7 percent
Last year, the Society for the Development of Macao Industrial Parks reached 10.01 million Patacas. The information was made available by the company in the Portal of the Directorate of Supervision and Management of Public Assets. The 2024 profits represent an increase of 7.37 percent compared to 2023, when the gains of the company detained by the Government of MSA had been 9.33 million patacas. Increased profits marks a reversal of the reduction trend compared to the period between 2022 and 2023, when a break of 71.8 percent of 33 million patacas from profits to 9.33 million patacas. However, at that time, the company explained that the 2022 profits had originated in extraordinary revenues about 31.8 million patacas, explained with “contract transfers”. In the year 2024, the main revenues of the company for the development of the industrial parks of Macao were due to the lease of the spaces in Concordia Park, in Coloane, and Transfronho Industrial Park Zhuhai-Macau, built on Verde Island. Last year the incomes surrendered to the company 18.18 million patacas, while the previous year the amount had been 18.15 million patacas. However, the big difference for increased profits was due to revenues from capital interest rates from 5.96 million patacas by 2023 to 7.30 million in 2024. More expenses Interest generated by the company contributed to disguise the wear and tear of operational profits, ie the difference between the company's gains with the main activity, the lease of spaces, and the operating expenses. As a result, operational profits went from 4.56 million patacas to 4.03 million patacas. This “wear” was mainly due to the increase in total expenses with members of the administration and workers, as the weight rose from 5.80 million patacas to 6.05 million patacas. In 2024, the company maintained the number of workers, which totaled 10 employees, but salary costs, which exclude payment of members of the administration, rose from 3.85 million patacas to 4.14 million patacas. The payment of members of the Administration increased from 1.36 million patacas to 1.43 million patacas. Last year, Lo Ioi Weng was replaced as chairman of the company's board by Chan Hon Sang, which has foreseen an annual compensation of 1.29 million Patacas. The Society for the Development of the Macao Industrial Parks has as its shareholders the MSAR and the Institute of Commerce and Investment Promotion (IPIM), which delivered 1.09 million PATACA in dividends, the same value as in 2023. Bet on diversification The Society for the Development of Macao Industrial Parks was created in 1993 with the aim of attracting investment and industries to Concórdia Park in Coloane. In 2003, the company was responsible for the exploitation of the Zhuhai-Macau Transfronho Industrial Park, built on Verde Island, a space created with the aim of diversifying the industry of the territory. The company aims to develop and manage land that were reserved for industrial development and related activities, according to the company's portal.

item.title: MGM | Macau welcomed Portuguese wines proof
item.description: MGM Macau was the stage on Tuesday of a Portuguese wine tasting event, which presented more than 100 wines from 13 producers to more than 200 sector professionals and consumers from all over the Great Bay. The “Wines of Portugal Macau 2025 Grand Tasting” was organized by the wines of Portugal, the national body promotion body. The day was also marked by a masterclass conducted by the educator of the wine of Portugal, Sofia Salvador, in which more than 50 people participated. Also present were Portuguese winemakers Jorge Seródio Borges, from Wine & Soul, in Douro, and Simon Baptista Cardoso, Quinta de Valbom and Herdade dos Grous, in Alentejo. The representative of the wines of Portugal stressed the importance of the territory for the projection of the Portuguese industry, where he occupies the third place in value and volume, after Australia and France. "We have been present in Macau for many years and, currently, we also see Macao as an excellent showcase for Portuguese wine, especially for the Chinese tourists of the continent," said Sofia Salvador.

item.title: Thai Prime Minister survives the motion of distrust
item.description: The Prime Minister of Thailand, Paetongtarn Shinawatra, survived yesterday to a motion of distrust in Parliament, which questioned the management of the economy and the links to the former leader and father, Thaksin Shinawatra, convicted of corruption. Paetongtarn, 38, who took office in August, was supported by 319 deputies, against 161, who voted against it, totaling 500 members of the Chamber of Representatives, the Baixa do Parliament As planned, the leader was supported by the 11 parties of the government coalition, led by Puea Thai (Thai people), a platform linked to the Shinawatra clan. The motion was presented Monday by the Popular Party, in opposition, heir to the Avanzar party, dissolved last August by a controversial court decision. During the two sessions preceding the vote, the debate turned around the poor performance of the Thai economy and the alleged influence of Thaksin, who ruled the country between 2021 and 2006, the year that was removed from power by a military coup. Paetongtarn, a first-minister candidate for PUEA Thai in the May 2023 elections, reached the power in August 2024, after the then leader Srettha Thavisin, also from PEA Thai, was deprived by order of the Constitutional Court after appointing minister a corruption-convicted leader. Do what I say Thaksin, Thailand's most influential and polarizing politician in the last 20 years, has returned to the country after spending almost 15 years in exile the same day Srettha has taken office. The former leader was arrested on arrival at Bangkok, accused of corruption, but did not pass a night in prison, having been transferred on the same day to a hospital, where he was six months old, and then placed in house arrest until his release, days after his daughter had risen to power. Thaksin, 75, claims to be taken from politics, but occasionally admitted to advice to the current leader and was seen to preside over meetings with other prominent Thai political leaders. The Reform Party Advance won the May 2023 elections, but failed to rule due to a Senate veto, then composed of representatives linked to the extinct military council. The party was eventually dissolved by the Constitutional Court, following an electoral promise to alter the laws that protect the Thai Royal House of criticism. PEA Thai, which initially allied with Advance, eventually agreed with a coalition government in which parties are associated with the military, once enemies of the Shinawatras.

item.title: Consulate | Citizen registers in -person vote after complaint
item.description: After unable to change the form of participation in the upcoming Portuguese legislative elections, vote for correspondence for face -to -face vote, at the Consulate General of Portugal in Macau and Hong Kong, Marcelino Marques filed a complaint to the National Election Commission, which eventually gave him reason and allows the face -to -face vote. In an email sent to the newsrooms, the Portuguese citizen indicates that he went to the consulate on March 19, after seeing at the media that the registration of face-to-face vote could be made until March 20. His claim was rejected due to alleged “administrative impediments” and was told “the system was already blocked in Portugal”. It should be noted that news about the deadline to request the registration of the face -to -face vote came from a publication of the Consulate General of Portugal in Macao and Hong Kong on March 18. The publication was eventually deleted the same day. Marcelino Marques also has known “many citizens resident in Macau” to whom the same claim was refused.

item.title: PAULO MAIA AND CARMO
item.description: Zhu Houcong (1507-67), Emperor Jiajing devoting a lot of his time to his own person, discovered the state's affairs, delegating them in the corrupt Yan Song (1480-1567) who, among other infamies, would have a recognized righteous man who denounced him in a memorial sent to the monarch where his resignation proposed. This is called this poet literate and painter Yang Jisheng (1516-1555). The animadversion he felt in the face of injustice, risking his life to tell the truth, did not allow him to falter. Late on the night of December 2, 1553, feeling grateful for so many things that life had given him, in a conversation with his wife, Mrs. Zhang, who installed him to avoid the conflict given the impossibility of counteracting Yan Song's power, he replied that this was the way he had to pay all the assets he had received, as he recalled in a chronological biography (Nianpu). And yet, like many celebrated literati, he had also suffered exile on the distant margins of the Empire. It was in the course of one of these days in 1551 that, moved by the beauty of a landscape, made the painting traveling along the roller coaster (vertical roll, paint on paper, 147.5 x 39.5 cm, sold on Sotheby's) where he reveals his scholarship in the art of painting the literati in which the painted figure tends to the abstraction and the accompanying poem. In front of the mountain, whose name can be translated as "the heavenly beauty," he writes: «The Tianhua Mountain is not too far west of the provincial city walls,/ which chases admire these climbing blue-peeled blue clutches and rocks of a red-red!/ Towers and pavilions settle to the mutant shapes of the descent and climbed the mountain,/ shadows of flags and shamelies up and down the trees. shining against the vision of the clean sky,/ clouds entering; One could catch one with the sleeve. Yang Jisheng made in this painting a literate traveling in a river on a vessel that is suddenly alerted by the boatman who with a staff points to houses nested on the mountain. As on an album page that signed Jiaoshan, "Pepper Mountain" (PAPER, 27 x 35 cm ink, sold in the auctioneer Nagel) represented a home hung on top of a mountain, would say the figuration of its search for a place in the world, which would after all to refuse it. In the night that preceded his execution he wrote a famous pair of verses, in a practice known as Juemingshi, "poem of a cut life", which seeks to make a brief reflection on the meaning of his own life: "Iron Shoulders, to carry the length and the way,/ the pungent hand to writing ingeniously."

item.title: BOAO FORUM | Ia, globalization and sustainability in discussion
item.description:
Another edition of the Boao Forum began in Haião, where topics such as artificial intelligence, globalization, current economic issues and sustainable development will be discussed. The head of the Executive of Masters departs today for the event, whose theme is “Asia in the world in transformation: towards a shared future”
Posters to announce another edition of the Boao Forum can be seen everywhere in Haião, the Chinese island that hosts the International Forum promoted by Beijing to discuss, with other countries, issues of economic, commercial and cooperation at various levels. The MSAR will be represented by an official delegation led by Sam Hou Fai, chief executive, who will be on the island between today and tomorrow. Liu Xianfa, commissioner of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the People's Republic of China in the MSAR, continues to join the delegation of MSAR as a guest advisor. The official delegation of the MSAR is also composed by the secretary for the economy and finance, Tai Kin IP, and the chief executive chief of the cabinet, Chan Kak. During the absence of Sam Hou Fai, the Secretary for Administration and Justice, André Cheong, will interim the functions of Chief Executive. The Boa Goveal Forum for Asia 2025 ends on Friday and has as its theme “Asia in the world in transformation: Towards a shared future” [Asia in the Changing World: Tows a Shared Future], and, according to a statement released by the chief executive's office, focuses on four essential areas, one of them “rebuilding confidence and promoting cooperation in a rapid transformation world”. Objectives are followed by "encouraging growth and rebalanced globalization for inclusive development" or "modeling the future and rapidly implementing the objectives of sustainable development to respond more effectively to global challenges." In turn, the fourth objective concerns a very current area: Artificial Intelligence (AI). It is thus intended to “explore potentialities and intensify AI's application and governance for development motivated by innovation”. According to the People's Daily Journal, this year are expected for more than two thousand participants from 60 countries and regions, being held 50 forums, or discussion groups, around the above objectives. 1,140 journalists are expected to coverage the event. The forecasts of a forum The main conferences of the Boao Forum include discussions about the Chinese and World Economy, namely in "High-Level dialogue: China's reform and economic predictions" and "construction of an open world economy: challenges and solutions." Following is “Improvement of the construction of digital capacity & conforming the gap between digital”, as well as “unlock the great potential of regional free trade agreements”. Among the remaining panels are also conversations about the potential of AI in "AI: how to ensure a balance between application and governance." Countries will also address the issue of global governance in the relationship with the United Nations (UN), in "high-level dialogue: global governance after the UN summit of the future." But the discussion forums start with some predictions made in the report released in the context of the Boao Forum, entitled "Asian Economic Outlook and Integration Progress". One of the forecasts is that the Gross Domestic Product (GDP) of the Asian continent should grow 4.5 percent this year, reported Xinhua. "Despite growing global economic uncertainty, Asia remains a key growth engine for the world economy," the report says. In addition, in terms of parity of purchasing power, the Asia GDP ratio, within the world total, is expected to increase from a registration of 48.1 percent last year to 48.6 percent this year. In turn, the report describes that the general situation of employment and wages “is improving in Asia”, with an unemployment rate of 4.39 percent for this year, less than the global rate of 4.96 percent. The Asian Economic Outlook and Integration Progress also highlights foreign investments in Asia, describing that China and Asean-Association of Southeast Asia nations "are the most appealing economies in Asia." In addition, it refers that the dependence on the internal and external foreign direct and external investment of Asian economies in the region itself reached 49.15 percent by 2023. From the point of view of the bidirectional dependence of IDE in Asia, China continued to be the most dependent economy of the Asian IDE flows, followed by Indonesia, with its dependence rates over 80 percent and 75 percent, respectively. The report also pointed out that China remains the center of global production value chains, and since 2017, global trade in intermediate goods has been more dependent on China than in North America. In 2023, China's global dependence on intermediate goods was 16 percent compared to 15 percent to North America. The commercial friction caused by the United States in 2018 did not raise their position in the global value chains of the transforming industry, the report added. Thus, the advance of Asia is also described in the level of emerging green technologies, since this is "driven by strong industrial capabilities and political support." Thus, the continent seems to be positioning itself "as a potential leader in advanced materials related to batteries or production of biodegradable plastics." China, Japan, and the Republic of Korea dominate the Lithium Battery Battery Technology Global Supply Chain, a factor considered crucial for the electrification of transport, the report underlines. However, China is at the forefront of the expanding green hydrogen industry in Asia, being the region responsible for almost 70 percent of the worldwide capacity of hydrogen electrolisters, also reveals the same report. An ecological island According to an Xinhua report, Haião Island, which welcomes the Boao Forum, is “a pioneer in development with low carbon emissions”, namely the use of photovoltaic energy. "On Dongyu Island, in Hainan province, southern China, the almost null carbon emissions demonstration zone is redefining harmony between humanity and nature-remodeling modern life through the integration of cutting-edge technology with sustainable development," he describes. But there are more technological news, such as the use of "a simple QR code that unlocks a coffee carbon emissions experience, and where a robotic arm prepares coffee using clean energy." There is also the bet on recycling, as "an advanced recycling cube separates the materials, converting them into" carbon points ", which can be changed to ecological awards." The area that welcomes the Boao Forum has a total area of ​​190 hectares, where a bet on “three key strategies” was made, namely the “renewal of ecological buildings, use of renewable energy and ecological transport”. The renewal of the zone for more sustainable bets will have begun in 2022, being proof of “how technological innovation and urban renewal can shape a future with low carbon emissions, paving the way for sustainable development, particularly in the tropical regions of the world,” says Xinhua. Also according to the same report, "one of the main strengths of the area lies in energy production capacity", currently producing "about 32 million kWh of green electricity, almost double its search for 17 million kWh". In turn, "surplus energy is introduced into the network, contributing to an annual savings of 7 720 tons of negative carbon resources," he said to Xinhua Ouyang Qinglun, deputy director of the Cosco Shipping Boao Co. Department of Engineering.

item.title: History | Lara Reis, Professor of Macao High School, remembered in Lisbon
item.description:
The former teacher of the Macao High School Fernando Lara Reis was remembered in the “Spring Conferences”, from the Macao Scientific and Cultural Center, by historian Celina Veiga de Oliveira. A native of Leiria, Lara Reis fought in the 1st World War and lived on Avenida da República, in the villa that today houses the Macau Red Cross house
Fernando Lara Reis was born in 1892 and died in 1950. Throughout a life filled with historical events and testimonies, the natural man of Leiria was a military man and a teacher at Macao High School, eventually making the territory his home. Lara Reis's life was recently remembered at the “Spring Conferences” of the Macao Scientific and Cultural Center (CCCM) by historian Celina Veiga de Oliveira, herself to her former teacher in the territory. At the session, the historian, who won the 2024 Macao International Institute Identity Award (IIM), recalled the “teacher, meritorious, driving of the arts”, and owner of “unusual knowledge”. “He was a native of Leiria and lived in Macao until his death. He attended Leiria High School, the Military College, then joined the Army School. In World War I was in Elvas, and then left to Angola in 1915 when he faced the German threat over Portuguese colonies in Africa. Observer-Aviator. ” Lara Reis was never a pilot as she wanted, having dedicated much of her life to teaching and Macao. “In 1919, Lara Reis went to Macao High School. He took a long circum-gap trip, leaving Portugal from Lisbon, going to the United States of America, crossed the entire territory and then went to Japan, down to Hong Kong and even Macau. He was a teacher in Macao, drawing, handicrafts and gymnastics until the end of his life,” said Celina Veiga de Oliveira. The historian took to the session some written testimonies left by other Macao figures who wrote about Lara Reis, namely Monsignor Manuel Teixeira in the book “Macao Lyceu”. He said he never found "no teacher who had served the High School with greater dedication." “He was a rigorous methodical teacher, whose military formation was certainly not oblivious to these characteristics. What was truly standing out was his artistic vein, because Lara Reis was always concerned with ascertaining the aesthetic meaning of the students and opening their mental horizons. This at the time when Macau was a small town. that he organized and also exhibitions by Portuguese and foreign artists he sponsored, ”he recalled. Celina Veiga de Oliveira also highlighted the words left by the writer Henrique de Senna Fernandes in an interview on "one of the greatest qualities of Lara Reis", which "besides rigor and discipline, was the consideration by the students, not distinguishing rich from the poor." Professor Lara Reis was "a party prosecutor who served to obtain tuition fees for needy students," and "he is due to the initiative of the creation of the High School Association, of which he was the first president." This association organized in the former canhydrome “sports parties of the end of the year when students performed the most difficult exercises”. Work done in Macau The historian also highlighted “another aspect of dedication to territory” by Lara Reis. The Leiriense "participated in the First World War and this led him to interest all those who were incorporated into this conflict, having founded the League of the Great War fighters and had built in the cemetery of St. Miguel Archangel the monument where the bodies of combatants rest." Moreover, "another facet of his personality was a taste for travel, because he had no family and thus left for the world." "I visited museums, art schools and photographed everything I saw, having created a estate with 32 volumes that is now a heritage of Leiria." Celina Veiga de Oliveira did not forget the old “Sol Pente” villa, located in the middle-leaf zone, namely the Avenida da República, which was the house of Lara Reis, later donated to the Santa Casa da Misericórdia de Macao to “an anti-cancer clinic that was the first institution of the genre in the Portuguese colonial space”. Today this villa serves as a house to the Red Cross of Macao, and on its walls you can find a stone with the following message: “In this building legacy by the Rotary Fernando Reis to the Santa Casa da Misericórdia de Macao, it was installed at the initiative of the Rotary Club of Macao the first anti-cancer fighting center on April 15, 1951.” “Change of Ares” When Fernando Lara Reis goes to Macao, political times are troubled, with the political agitation to be lived in China after the fall of the Empire and the Republican Revolution of 1911. "In the 1920s the nationalist shock waves lived in the Canton, which sometimes haunted the Portuguese enclave quiet, but never moved with everyday life. The Portuguese administration guaranteed a standard appearance, and the parties at Christmas, Chinese New Year, the religious festivities of the Catholic community and the Chinese population were habitual." Celina Veiga de Oliveira recalled that in the late 1920s, Lara Reis decided to transfer to Goa, a trip that would only accentuate her belonging to Macau. “In the late 1920s, he felt he was time to change his air and asked to be transferred to the Afonso de Albuquerque High School in Pangim, and was there between 1941 and 1945, taking the opportunity to know India, and met the whole country. Instead, with a graceful and already sick license, choosing Macau to be his last address, ”he recalled. Celina Veiga de Oliveira recordou também as palavras de Orlando Cardoso, que no artigo “Macau e o Oriente na vida de Lara Reis” falou do homem que se deslumbrou com Macau “a partir do momento em que, às 8 horas da noite de 23 de Outubro de 1919, avistou pela primeira vez o Farol da Guia, um pouco antes de se instalar no ‘New Macao Hotel’ e sorver de sentidos atentos os sons, os cheiros e as luzes desta porta of an immeasurable and fantastic Asia that he would describe to exhaustion. ” These Lara Reis testimonies are “in a remarkable set of travel books that lay virtually unexplored in all their research potentialities on the shelves of the Leiria District Archive”, and were investigated by Orlando Cardoso himself. In the same article, this one refers to a text from the newspaper “News of Macau” of January 17, 1950, about Lara Kings: “The Auster and Worsen Teacher; the tenacious and thorough tourist; the military who fought and consecrated the memory of those who fell in the field of struggle; the honest and firm friend; the lovely and humorous companion; social celibate that, despite this, did not disdain any opportunity to undo its gallants, always kind and inconsequential to any palm with a face that in the goto ”. Given the few studies that exist about Lara Reis and the estate he left, Celina Veiga de Oliveira left a suggestion: "May the CCCM get the detailed index of the Leiria Archive, so that the research is possible for any interested researchers."

item.title: Public Hiring | New regime “is on the good way,” says lawyer
item.description:
Marco Caldeira, a lawyer and auxiliary teacher at the University of Lisbon Faculty of Law, argues that the proposed public hiring law, under analysis in the specialty in Hemiciclo, is “on the good way” regarding the attempt to “promote transparency and competition and bet on digitization”. The theme was discussed last week at the Macau Scientific and Cultural Center
The proposal of public hiring, currently under analysis in the specialty in the First Permanent Commission of the Legislative Assembly (AL), was one of the topics addressed in the “Spring Conferences”, at the Macao Scientific and Cultural Center (CCCM) last week. The author of the lecture, the lawyer and teacher Marco Caldeira, made praise for the diploma for his attempt to reform and innovation in many respects. "Although not perfect, the bill under discussion is justified by the need to update legislation that was approved four decades ago. It is a proposal that seems to point in the good way, with an effort to codify the regime, promote transparency and competition and bet on digitization," said the professor at the University of Lisbon Law School (FDUL) to HM. In addition, Marco Caldeira understands that the diploma, and the content proposed by the government, aims to "follow what are good practices adopted in Europe and the West in general." "It is also very commendable that the proposal was prepared following a serious and participated procedure of public consultation, which gave the opportunity to economic operators and contracting entities to identify deficiencies in current legislation and make suggestions," added Marco Caldeira. At the CCCM session, the FDUL professor also pointed out that the concern [demonstrated, in the diploma] with the competition and transparency of the procedures ”, as well as“ the focus on training in the use of databases, as well as the focus on centralization ”. The teacher also understood that, in this bill, the Portuguese regime "can help, because the practice followed in Portugal, and legislative evolutions, have useful teachings that, with proper adaptations, can be transposed to Macao." Positive points In the presentation at CCCM, Marco Caldeira highlighted several positive aspects of the current law proposal, namely “the express determination of inapplicability to certain contracts”, or the fact that “fundamental principles of public hiring” are established. It is also required with the new law “qualifications to candidates and competitors” of public tenders, and there is also “the clarification and standardization of the types of public hiring procedures”. Thus, a “centralized hiring regime” is created, as well as regulating “award criteria” in competitions, and the creation of an exclusive website for the public hiring area is also foreseen. Marco Caldeira also drew attention to the real need of this diploma, as public hiring was legislated with various diplomas, including two decrees of 1984 and 1985, which established, respectively, the expenditure regime with works and service acquisitions, and the process of acquisition of goods and services. Such diplomas were “undone of reality” of Macao, even though the 1984 decree was reviewed in 2021, the teacher considered. Marco Caldeira also considered that the process of reviewing this diploma has been “lengthy”, as the public consultation took place between November 6, 2018 and January 4, 2019, and a later report was prepared, but the truth is that the proposal has been under analysis since December 2023, having been voted generally on January 11 last year. What has to change In the same session, the causal and university professor also highlighted the points already addressed by the first Standing Commission of AL regarding the necessary changes to legislate in the area of ​​public hiring. It was imposed “expressly consecrating fundamental legal principles, such as economy, efficiency and effectiveness, as well as publicity and transparency”, and there is also “a lack of regulation of public hiring policies”. There was also the “need to promote transparency in public hiring procedures” and ensure “greater protection of loyal competition”. There was also “lack of rigorous and explicit regulation on the composition and operation of the proposals evaluation committees” submitted to a public tender, and there is “lack of explicit demands on the qualifications and capabilities of candidates and competitors in hiring procedures”. Other gaps point to “insufficient regulation and transparency in the evaluation and adjudication procedures”, or “lack of explicit regulation on proposals presentation with an abnormally low price”. It was still necessary to “improve the sanctioning and inspection regime”, as well as bet on “regulation that promotes the development of electronic hiring”. Says the executive Looking at the justification of the law proposal, submitted by the Executive to AL, it is read that one of the great reasons for his presentation was even the legislative dispersion that was verified and the misfit over the current reality. "The nuclear part of these diplomas was prepared in the mid-1980s, and has been in force for over 30 years. A significant part of the provisions of other legal diplomas already has an obvious divergence regarding the needs of Macao's current socioeconomic development, the efficiency of public administration management and the reinforcement of transparency and supervision," he reads. According to the executive, "given that public hiring involves the use of the public purse, it is essential to review these regimes in order to meet the needs of the society of our day." Thus, in this law proposal, “the process and regime of expenses and acquisitions of goods and services” are regulated, with some provisions of a 1999 law, as “the provisions related to the public works contract regime have a high degree of specialization and are still effective”. It is intended, with the new law of public hiring, to “guarantee justice, impartiality in the evaluation of proposals”, defining “expressly aid criteria and rigorously determining the rules of conduct of workers and members of the opening and evaluation of proposals” subjected to contest, so that “excerpt their functions impartially and entirely”. Thus, it is foreseen that “contracting entities must adequately publicize the informative elements related to public hiring procedures”. They are “those related to the public tender, the clarifications provided, the rectification of documents, the extension of the deadline for the presentation of proposals, the causes for non -adjudication, the decision to annul the procedure and the award decision”. In order to guarantee loyal competition, the government wants to ensure that all entities interested in participating in a competition have “the broader access” to all procedures, prohibiting “all acts, agreements or practices that can prevent, false or restrict competition”. Moreover, there is the “principle of impartiality”, which determines that “the program of procedures, book of charges or other documents, made by the contracting party, cannot contain any clause designed to favor or harm a particular interested party”.

item.title: Apomac | Jorge Fão regrets lack of people to manage association
item.description:
APOMAC - Macao's retirees, retired and pensioners association goes to elections tomorrow with a unique list. Francisco Mannão competes again for president, Jorge Fão for the General Assembly and Daniel Mendonça to the Fiscal Council. Mannão suggests the creation of a “satellite city” only for the elderly and calls for pensions update
Increasing the elderly pensions would be "gold on blue." In the meantime, Francisco Mannão continues to fight for this and other flags designed to improve the lives of older residents, again leading the candidate list for the management of Apomac - Macao's retirees, retirees and pensioners association, which take place tomorrow. The list is unique and the faces have little or nothing difference from previous years: Jorge Fão continues to lead the General Assembly, while Daniel Mendonça competes for the Fiscal Council. There is only one new name in the position of Member of the Fiscal Council. "It is very difficult to find people available to do this volunteer work. Jorge and I would like to find someone who could replace us, because we are for a long time in this association. We are elderly, but we have energy. As long as we have strength on the legs to walk, we are walking and trying to do our best by Apomac," Francisco Mannhão told HM. Jorge Fão highlights the fact that Apomac has been about to celebrate 25 years since the foundation, noting that there is, in fact, a leadership problem that if not solved can culminate in the disappearance of the association. "We are not seeing the emergence of another list of younger and younger people, so that we offer our services for another term and so on, as far as possible. There is a leading problem at Apomac and in other associations. The Apomac issue is more serious, because we have been standing for 24 years, we will celebrate in May." Satellite city and pensions In a list that will lead the association by 2028, the motto is “we are elderly but energetic”, reads in the action program. At the first point, it is indicated that the team's objective is "to monitor the government's policy and the Macau Foundation, with a view to adjusting the needs of our action program throughout this three -year term." In addition, they intend to "provide the necessary support to members so that they can enjoy the benefits awarded by the Government of MSAR and other official entities." One of the requests on the list to the government led by Sam Hou Fai is the increase in pensions, which is currently 3,740 patacas. It would be for the association would be the update to four thousand monthly patacas. "It would be good for the government of MSar to pay the pension monthly to the elderly, the pecuniary compensation and the old age, instead of having to wait every three months to receive the pension for the elderly, seven months to receive the pecuniary compensation and ten months to receive old age. Hm. Another idea left by Francisco Mannão is from the construction of a satellite city only for elderly dwellings, in what would be a larger project against residence for the elderly already built by the executive, in the area of ​​sand black. "I liked the Government of MSA to build a satellite city for the elderly. I worry a lot because there are many living alone, and with the construction of this satellite city they no longer have problems of loneliness, and could live with each other, and can provide services common to all. The construction of high buildings is good, but for the elderly it is not that good," he defended. Still, Mannão assures that being elderly in Macau is much easier than in Hong Kong. “Nowadays, in Macau, the elderly live quite well, because there are many social support attributed to this group of people. Sufficient resources Asked about the essential points to make Apomac a larger association, Francisco Mannhão says that “they have enough”, but lames the closure of the clinic where they were provided to the elderly health care. "Of course we had the plan to be able to develop our headquarters more, but due to the lack of the allowance we had to end our clinic. In this context, we had a program to develop this area that had to be abandoned, and that would benefit our associates. We tried to organize more lectures about health, because the senior group needs to know more about disease and health affairs, something that can generate great concerns." In political terms, Francisco Mannhão, who was even a candidate for deputy to the Legislative Assembly, says that Apomac is an advocate of the principle of “one country, two systems”, thought by Beijing to the regions of Macau and Hong Kong. "We agree with the national policy of 'a country, two systems', so that Macau can be a paradise for us. So far we have been quite well in Macau, we have no problems, but we would like this principle to continue." A lot of bureaucracy One of the services provided by Apomac goes through bureaucratic support to the elderly in communication with the General Retirement Caixa (CGA), in the case of former civil servants who receive the reform of Portugal, or the Macao Pension Fund. "The communication with CGA has improved a little, but the bureaucratic part is still very difficult to deal with on the part of our associates. Not long ago one of our associates has waited more than three years for an amount of an amount that was improperly charged," said Francisco Mannão. Jorge Fão, in turn, stressed that Apomac is also popular with non -partners, including from the Chinese community, to treat various issues, such as requests for subsidies or funeral -related paperwork. Still looking at the Action program, Apomac's list also aims to “organize more sightseeing tours to mainland China, making known its culture and success of the country”, as well as the promotion of “more coexistence, so that members join periodically”. Much sought after by the dining service, since in Apomac some dishes of macanese gastronomy can be eaten, the list wants to "improve the management of the canteen whenever possible." Asked if many elderly from Macau want to pass the renovation in China one day, at a time when regional integration is increasingly a reality, Francisco Mannão admits yes, although many “prefer to stay in the territory, as they have their life rooted here, being used to the uses and customs of Macao”. "The Government of MSA has been doing a lot of work so that they can join the great bay," he said.

item.title: Aviation | Maria José de Freitas regrets removal of panels from the airport
item.description:
The first attempts to establish in Macao airlines in the early twentieth century were approached by historian Célia Reis in the “Spring Conferences” of the Macao Scientific and Cultural Center. The architect Maria José de Freitas regretted the removal of panels from Macao International Airport that told this same story
Between the departure of the plane and the entrance to Macao International Airport (AIM) was a corridor that told the history of civil and military aviation from the territory of the early twentieth century. The project of this area of ​​the airport is by the studio of architect Maria José de Freitas, which regrets the removal of the panels and historical information that were installed in 2013. The architect left this idea in an intervention after the presentation of historian Célia Reis about the history of civil and military aviation in Macao on Monday, on the occasion of the “Spring Conferences” that take place at the Macao Scientific and Cultural Center (CCCM) in Lisbon. “We decided to tell the story of Aviation in Macao in this corridor, with a great extent, although at the time there was little documentation about it. I discovered some information in a work by Luís Andrade de Sá. We collected texts and images and put it all on the walls of this corridor, and that was there for a while.” "With a new direction [at AIM], I was asked how I could prove that all these events had happened. I had documentation in Portuguese, but I had nothing in Chinese and English, and at a time when I moved to Portugal on vacation, I saw, when I returned to Macau, who had removed all the information and images from this corridor. This story is unfortunate," he added. The architect added that she would like the history of the early days of Aviation in Macao to be told in these same walls. "It would be important to realize where there is more information, so that they realize the history of aviation in Macao, which was a pioneer. There was, for example, an aviation hangar near the mud houses, and there are a series of references linked to the history of this land that should be made visible at the airport, in the rooms, for example. This story should be told and things should be placed in the right place," he said. Ricou plans Célia Reis, historian and teacher, is developing an investigation project around the early days of aviation in Macao and this was the theme that led to the “spring conferences” on Monday, with the session “Aviation and Air Navigation in Macao in the 1920s-a process of colonial innovation”. Célia Reis spoke of a time when aviation began to be important to China for security reasons, and also begins to be thought to Macau. In this process, there is a personality whose name is important, a Hong Kong -born Frenchman: Charles William Ricou, a engineering and aviation pilot. From November 1919 the possibility of “establishing an air career between Macao, Hong Kong, Shanghai, Philippines, Java, India” began to equate, from November 1919, the possibility of Macaoi, Shanghai, Java, India, "contacting local government entities to obtain facilities and agreements. Célia Reis explained that Ricou intended to form two airlines, the “Far East Aviation Company”, with “a much wider connection, reaching Manila”, and another to connect Macau, Hong Kong and Cantão, named “Macau Aerial Transport Company”. This company "was constituted in Hong Kong, with a capital of $ 50,000, and had as founding partners personalities from Macau, such as Humberto de Avelar, Rodrigues dos Santos, Francisco Nolasco and Francisco da Silva". The historian also said in the presentation that the idea "was to complete the rest of the capital necessary with low value actions so that they could be bought by all [the inhabitants] in Macao." "There is even the appeal of the company's board of directors for the Macanese to subscribe to capital, showing that the company was extremely important for the inhabitants of Macao, highlighting its patriotic value, of solidarity with progress," he added. "Several voices demonstrated at that time that the company's commercial success, at first, could be little or none, although it was thought that the company could have some profits, having the ability to transport the air mail. However, this transportation capacity would be extremely limited, as the number of mail objects to transport from Macau was 24 letters a day," said Célia Reis. At the time it was thought that Macau would be a pioneer, because "it would be the first territory to the East to have an aviation company", something that would "bring more visitors and increase trade." The Government of Macao, then led by Governor Correia da Silva, "gives in to the company's appeals, granting various facilities, such as the permission to build a provisional hangar on public ground that was vacant or from sea access infrastructure." In addition, “exemption from payment of the fuel storage tax” was allowed. Thus, Macao even had hydroavião and 21 American airmen hired by the company. "It was considered that it was the largest load of air material exported by the United States of America (USA), all brought to Macao." Then the company tries to organize itself, "even asking for space on Taipa Island, designed to have definitive hangars, although provisional concessions have existed." In this context, he recalled the historian, "there were subsidies, a contract for the transportation of postal bags", to "allow a development of air navigation." Impasses to the end In May 1920, a new worldwide aviation convention emerged, to which Portugal adheres, which causes the “Macau Aerial Transport Company” to be nationalized. The project comes to advance, but quickly retreats. “The airline therefore accesses the condition of obtaining a subsidy, and having four aircraft available for military service in Macau, if necessary. The issue of defense was always present. There was then some disagreement between the conditions required by the company and those that the governor understood were necessary. In addition, the government of Macao needed the Lisbon authorization for the operation of the airline. Advance, and this one begins to negotiate with the company. But voices begin to emerge in Lisbon that will make things change. ” This is the idea that the US would be showing hidden interests through the establishment of the company. "[In Lisbon] it is fear that this is the found form of an American aviation company to settle in Macao, Portuguese territory, by different ways." First, Lisbon forbids, retreating in the negotiations, and the next governor, Rodrigo Rodrigues, "is not in accordance with the company, understanding that it will not be viable," which leads to the entire project and dialogue to be suspended. Célia Reis also pointed out that "the government of Correia da Silva has undergone several difficulties in these years, in terms of security", having occurred "very serious incidents in the relationship between Portugal and China". “For this reason, the governor considered that having airplanes was extremely important because, at this moment, China was also resorting to aviation. The authorities of Portugal, however, considered that the planes of Macao would be of no importance, comparing with the set of aircraft that would have China or even Japan. When permission for the constitution of the airline in Macao, Lisbon understands that the territory could have in a worrying situation and planes could have functions with planes Military, even if there were few, ”explained the historian. The project would fall, however, by land.

item.title: The garden of Almerindo in Timor-Leste can be watered from Portugal or England
item.description: The Garden of the Timorese Almerindo Fernandes in Lautém, 231 kilometers east from Dili, can be watered from Portugal or England, after the civil engineer applied new technologies to the agricultural sector. Almerindo Fernandes, 30, has a degree in Civil Engineering and for years has worked on rural road construction projects, but the 'animal' for agriculture spoke louder and today owns Timor-Leste's first 'smart farm'. In Lautém, Almerindo Fernandes has about two hectares of terrain, where he planted eggplant, tomatoes and other vegetables, which watering through an intelligent irrigation system that controls through a platform on his mobile phone. "It means that in Portugal or England we can water the garden with the mobile phone. It's the modern world, the world of technology, digitization. It's the opportunity to use technology, using the mobile phone to water my garden," he told Lusa. "It is a great opportunity to use technology to modernize agricultural productions," he said. With about 1.3 million inhabitants, the agricultural sector in Timor-Leste is vital to the economy of the country, but production is low and did not follow the growth of the population. According to the United Nations Food and Agriculture Organization, more than 70% of the Timorese population lives in rural areas and most practice subsistence agriculture. Almerindo Fernandes started the activity in 2017 with the money he was sparing while working as a civil engineer and today sells his production to the school lunch program, the Armed Forces and the markets of his municipality. “So far it was a private activity, but the government is supporting the expansion of the project to the other municipalities of the country,” explained Almerindo Fernandes. The support was achieved after presenting the project to the vice-prime minister, coordinating minister of social affairs and Minister of Rural Development and Community Housing, Mariano Assanami Sabino, who eventually hired him as a specialized technician to bring the concept to the rest of the country. “The government recognizes the creativity of young people and all citizens who have creative initiatives. It is a great opportunity and the government is supporting the transformation of the garden into a youth formation center,” explained Almerindo Fernandes. In the garden, Almerindo Fernandes already has to work four people permanent and then hire others to plant, take the vegetables and do the maintenance, and at the same time gives training to young people who study agriculture. Now, according to the civil engineer, the garden also serves to do experiences to improve the system, that is, to make it more efficient and effective, with “little spent and greater performance”. "It is the principle of modernization, increased production, minimal cost is the purpose of the intelligent garden system and it is a theory we have to adapt to Timor to develop the country," he said.

item.title: IC | Launched book on the historical roots of Rua das Estlagês
item.description:
“In Search of Its Roots - An Illustrated History of Street of Estalagins” is the name of the work Bilingual, launched in digital format, which tells the story of this historic street of Macao, revealing the business that survived the passage of time. Production was in charge of the Macao Artists Society, with the support of the Cultural Institute and Sands China
The history serpes through the stalage street since the end of the nineteenth century. The narrow artery has always been the scene of an intense social and commercial rebolement and it was where Sun Yat-Sen, considered the father of modern China and the Republican Revolution, opened pharmacies and drugstores, especially from 1893. Over the years, Rua das Estalagem, in Porto, was a living example of commerce, and the Portuguese governors were progressively expanding the street, composed of the street Chinese -style buildings and temples, such as the Temple of the Bazaar and Goddess Temple NOVA WO. All these pieces of history are now counting on the digital publication “In Search of Its Roots - An Illustrated History of Rua das Estlagês”, a work produced by the Society of Macao Artists and authored by Siguo Chen in Shirley Lule's texts and illustrations. Those responsible for the edition are the Cultural Institute (IC) and the game operator Sands China. According to a press release of Sands China, the book, in Chinese and English, intends to “highlight the fascinating past of the historic Macau Street and the beauty of its legacy”, containing interviews with street -related figures, whether merchants or residents. Thus, it is intended to bring “residents and visitors to rediscover the preciousness of the centenary stores and the cultural heritage of the street through legendary stories” so that they can “widen their understanding of the transformation of the neighborhood and its inhabitants”. The content of the book results from “close conversations with representatives of associations, business entities and residents of the neighborhood,” having dozens of oral stories that can easily be lost if not recorded. This work is not closed in the digital world, having been printed to appear in the public libraries of Macao and schools, in order to “promote the meaning of cultural heritage and enhance mutual ties among the people of Macao”, intending to be “a valuable community resource to deepen the understanding and appreciation of Macao and the street”. 200 years of history One of the highlights given in the book is to the textile sector that has always predominated on Rua das Estlagenas. In the chapter entitled "Two Centuries of Prosperity: Spinning A Legacy in the Textiles Trade" [two centuries of prosperity: the construction of a legacy in the textile trade], it is read that "Street of Estlagins has always been a center for the textile industry." In the years when the textile sector had a larger presence in the territory, between the 70's and 90's, "Rua housed more than 20 stores with factory products, including three spaces from the Veng On Farm Store." “Around 30 businesses related to these stores, such as tailors, clothing stores, western products and funeral ornament stores, which brought a reputation to the street,” he reads. In Rua das Estlagenas “Tissue trade is over 200 years old,” says the same text. Other chapters of the book speak of the presence of the republican revolutionary in Macao in “The Starting Point of Sun Yat-Sen’s Story” [The Starting Point of the story of Sun Yat-Sen] or stories of street-linked personalities and their commerce. In the conclusion of the work, it refers that after the transition, the street "faced new challenges: the global financial crisis, the SARS epidemic, the COVID-19, and the uncertainty of the economy, leaving the need for renewal again." "In the past, the business has flourished, by themselves, thanks to hard work and resilience. But nowadays the community joins with a shared vision, actively planning [the development of the street] with the support of the Macao government and the integrated resort companies. With these efforts, there is a sense of hope that the street of the stalage will briefly recover its old vitality, being ready for a new era." Institutional view IC President Deland Leong Wai Man pointed out that the book results from the “weighted effort to widen the discussion around preservation and revitalization [of the street],” according to the same press release. "Street renewal is expected to inspire more people to learn about the historic neighborhoods of Macao and participate in their preservation, combining ideas and resources to ensure that the city's culture and history continue to prosper during generations," he said. In turn, Wilfred Wong, CEO of Sands China, argued that "Street of Estalagues is a microcosm of Macao itself, a place where a rich story meets a modern future." "The walls of their alleys witnessed the transformation of Macao, and their stories and people deserve to be remembered, as they are precious sources of Macao's cultural heritage. Our effort to publish the book was possible thanks to the collaboration of our local team to conduct interviews with owners of historical stores, create illustrations and take pictures, among other works," he said. New facades It is recalled that this publication arises after the Government was announced by the Sands performance at the Rua das Estalagens Revitalization Plan, namely with the “Entrepreneurs Recruitment Program for Rua das Estlagês”, launched in April last year. The game operator explains that the seven businesses selected for the initiative “have been opening through phases, bringing energy to the zone along with other new businesses, providing a platform for young ambitious entrepreneurs to realize their dreams”. In addition, the game operator intends to revitalize stores' façades “with drawings that enhance their characteristics, resonating the history of the street and the city”. For this initiative, Sands has also collaborated with the Macao Artist Society, and the drawings will be created by two young local artists, Chek On Law and Sit Kat Kit. "The aim is that, with a collective effort like this, the community can rediscover the history of the street and learn about its past stories and stores through the visual interpretations of these local artists from Macao and their perceptions of the territory," he reads. Siguo Chen, the book's author, is a veteran journalist with a career of over 60 years who has been deeply linked to the media area in Macau and Hong Kong.

item.title: DSEDJ | Government wants young people to celebrate victory in the war against Japan
item.description: The Directorate of Youth Education and Development Services (DSEDJ) wants to see the young people of Macao celebrating the “80th anniversary of the victory of the Chinese people's resistance against Japanese aggression and world victory against fascism” and, therefore, will fund various activities in schools. The revelation was made by the vice president of the Youth Council, and director of DSEDJ, Kong Chi Meng, at the meeting that took place on Tuesday. The goal is to lead "young people and students to better understand the history of the resistance war and increase the feeling of belonging to the nation and love of the country." According to the official statement of the meeting, financing fits the program for young people “looking for red roots” and has as recipients the local schools and associations. The representatives of DSEDJ also framed the financing of activities in the “implementation of patriotic education with young people and students in different aspects and forms” in the “continuous enrichment of the work content of patriotic education” and the “comprehensive dissemination of the social fundamental value of love for the homeland and Macao through attractive means”. At the meeting, the Secretary for Social and Culture Affairs and President of the Youth Council was also present, LAM, which warned the Youth Council that “patriotic education work must be developed more deepened, more detailed and more appropriate” in the future and that the hengqin cooperation zone should be used as a “exchange platform between young people from Macau and the interior”. Lam also linked that Xi Jinping pays close attention to the formation of Macao young people.

item.title: Mountain Island | Complaints of obstacles to integration
item.description:
Long lines to cross the border, insufficient health services, non -recognized addresses and letters that never reach the destination. These are some of the problems of Macao residents in Hengqin, that Deputy Nick Lei expects the government to be able to resolve
Deputy Nick Lei states that there are many obstacles to ensure the integration of Macao residents in Hengqin, and asks authorities to take new measures to improve the situation. Heard by the Citizen Journal, the deputy linked to the Fujian community indicated as one of the main obstacles the lack of conditions to cross the border, which makes those who live in Hengqin, but work or study in Macau has to often face long lines, especially during holidays or in the edge hours. As a solution to this issue, the deputy proposes that Macao authorities coordinate with the hengqin customs to install automatic border calculations or inspection channels only for Macao residents, in order to increase the speed of border passage. Regarding the identified problems, Nick Law also points out that the Health Center of the new Macao neighborhood of Hengqin, which began operating in November last year, has no regular blood harvesting service. Another of the identified flaws is the fact that some drugs available in Macao are not in Hengqin. Health services in the neighborhood for residents of Macau are thus considered insufficient. Law even reveals that there were residents who had to come to Macau to receive the necessary health treatments as they were not available in Hengqin. Bureaucratic problems In the list of complaints that appears in the statements made to the Citizen Journal, Nick Lei states that several residents find difficulties when they have to declare the address on Mountain Island with public services or financial institutions of Macao. According to the deputy, it is often that Hungqin addresses are not accepted in local institutions as a resident recognized in Macao. Another frequent situation happens when the home on mountain island is recognized, but correspondence never reaches the destination. Law thus asks the authorities to ask the post office on the other side of the border to find a way to overcome this obstacle. On the other hand, law regretted that the measure of the interior authorities so that the macao enrolled cars authorized to circulate in Hengqin could circulate throughout the Canton province has not yet come out of paper, although announced. Nick Law understands that integration is a process that takes its time, but argues that these aspects should be improved quickly to attract more residents from Macau to Hengqin.

item.title: Industrial Parks | Company with profits of 10 million patacas
item.description:
Despite the company's operational profits for the development of Macau's industrial parks worsened with 2023, capital interest gains allowed to improve results by about 7 percent
Last year, the Society for the Development of Macao Industrial Parks reached 10.01 million Patacas. The information was made available by the company in the Portal of the Directorate of Supervision and Management of Public Assets. The 2024 profits represent an increase of 7.37 percent compared to 2023, when the gains of the company detained by the Government of MSA had been 9.33 million patacas. Increased profits marks a reversal of the reduction trend compared to the period between 2022 and 2023, when a break of 71.8 percent of 33 million patacas from profits to 9.33 million patacas. However, at that time, the company explained that the 2022 profits had originated in extraordinary revenues about 31.8 million patacas, explained with “contract transfers”. In the year 2024, the main revenues of the company for the development of the industrial parks of Macao were due to the lease of the spaces in Concordia Park, in Coloane, and Transfronho Industrial Park Zhuhai-Macau, built on Verde Island. Last year the incomes surrendered to the company 18.18 million patacas, while the previous year the amount had been 18.15 million patacas. However, the big difference for increased profits was due to revenues from capital interest rates from 5.96 million patacas by 2023 to 7.30 million in 2024. More expenses Interest generated by the company contributed to disguise the wear and tear of operational profits, ie the difference between the company's gains with the main activity, the lease of spaces, and the operating expenses. As a result, operational profits went from 4.56 million patacas to 4.03 million patacas. This “wear” was mainly due to the increase in total expenses with members of the administration and workers, as the weight rose from 5.80 million patacas to 6.05 million patacas. In 2024, the company maintained the number of workers, which totaled 10 employees, but salary costs, which exclude payment of members of the administration, rose from 3.85 million patacas to 4.14 million patacas. The payment of members of the Administration increased from 1.36 million patacas to 1.43 million patacas. Last year, Lo Ioi Weng was replaced as chairman of the company's board by Chan Hon Sang, which has foreseen an annual compensation of 1.29 million Patacas. The Society for the Development of the Macao Industrial Parks has as its shareholders the MSAR and the Institute of Commerce and Investment Promotion (IPIM), which delivered 1.09 million PATACA in dividends, the same value as in 2023. Bet on diversification The Society for the Development of Macao Industrial Parks was created in 1993 with the aim of attracting investment and industries to Concórdia Park in Coloane. In 2003, the company was responsible for the exploitation of the Zhuhai-Macau Transfronho Industrial Park, built on Verde Island, a space created with the aim of diversifying the industry of the territory. The company aims to develop and manage land that were reserved for industrial development and related activities, according to the company's portal.

item.title: Financial Reserve | Year starts with gains of 5.3 billion
item.description: Macau's financial reserve began 2025 on the rise, with the value of assets increasing 5.3 billion patacas in January, was announced yesterday. The reserve value was 621.5 billion patacas in late January, according to data published in the official bulletin. Still, the value remains away from the record of 663.6 billion patacas reached in February 2021, in the middle of the pandemic. According to data from the Macao Monetary Authority (AMCM), the reserve had recorded by 2024 the best year since the COVID-19 pandemic after earning 35.7 billion patacas. This was the highest annual increase since 2019, when the value of the reserve increased by 70.6 billion patacas. The value of the extraordinary reserve at the end of January was 452 billion Patacas and the basic reserve, equivalent to 150 percent of the Macao Public Budget, was 164.2 billion Patacas. The territory budget for 2025 foresees a 7 percent increase in total expenses to 109.4 billion patacas. The Macao Financial Reserve is mostly consisting of deposits and current accounts worth 248.1 billion, credit securities of 119.3 billion patacas and up to 247.6 billion in subcontractors. In 2024, investments surrendered to the financial reserve nearly 31 billion patacas, corresponding to a 5.3 percent profitability rate, AMCM said in late February.

item.title: TDM | Sam Hou Fai replaces Neto Valente in the Fiscal Council
item.description: Lawyer Jorge Neto Valente was replaced as President of the TDM Fiscal Council - Macao Teledifusion, by decision of the Chief Executive, Sam Hou Fai. The decision was revealed yesterday in the official bulletin. Macanese António Dias Alado was chosen for president of the Fiscal Council, reveals the same document.
